sentences.en: "You change the albedo of the Earth, " he explained.
sentences.cn: 他解释道：“因为你改变了地球的反照率。

sentences.en: A similar example of lowered albedo occurs when sea-ice melts and disappears, causing the darker coloured sea underneath to absorb more heat.
sentences.cn: 当海冰融化消失时，会同样降低反射率，导致深色的海底吸收更多的热量。

sentences.en: Cloudy areas can also be areas of radiation deficit because of their higher albedo.
sentences.cn: 有云区也可能是输射亏损区,因为云有较高的反照率.

sentences.en: Different varieties of the same plant can vary in how much light they reflect, a property called albedo, so selecting for higher-albedo crops would enhance the cooling effect from agriculture.
sentences.cn: 同一类植物的不同品种具有不同的反射率，而选择那些反射率更高的品种将能提高农业对控制全球变暖的贡献。

sentences.en: If the stellar spectrum is known, the albedo of the dust can be obtained.
sentences.cn: 如果恒星的光谱已知, 就可得出尘埃的反照率.

sentences.en: Not affected by colors or albedo. Any objects can be detected.
sentences.cn: 不受颜色及反射率的影响,可来测全何被测物.

sentences.en: These bands must introduce longitudinal asymmetry in the planetary albedo.
sentences.cn: 这些云带必定引起行星反照率的经向不对称性.

words.tran_cn: （行星等的）[核][天]反射率；星体反照率

trans.tran_en: the ratio of the intensity of light reflected from an object, such as a planet, to that of the light it receives from the sun
